posts.post_content:
In timespiral, Endrek, just like Mishra and other dead ppl, got a second chance in life through the time rifts. Endrek got executed for making too many thrulls and making them [too smart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=1868) or [parasitic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=159171) to the Ebon Hand. Now, with a second chance, he has to manage his thrulls to keep em secret, or he'll be executed again for breeding. You can also just let him go crazy with his passion, whatever the consequences.  
He's my general and I keep him on his meds, with a lot of sacrifice outlets and only one 7cmc creature ([butcher of malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=butcher of malakir), but thats totally worth it).  
read the full article on him here: http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/feature/372
posts.html:

He's my general and I keep him on his meds, with a lot of sacrifice outlets and only one 7cmc creature (butcher of malakir, but thats totally worth it).
read the full article on him here: http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/feature/372

posts.post_content: If you can keep his crowd of Thrulls under control, it seems like this guy would work well with creatures with Devour. You plop any creature with CMC 6 or less down, Endrek does his thing, and suddenly you have a whole bunch of munchies for your [Predator Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Predator Dragon)/[Thunder-Thrash Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thunder-Thrash Elder)/whatever other Devour creature you use.

posts.post_content:
Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card. The legendary creatures in these sets were also all characters from previous sets who had yet to see print.  
  
This card depicts the biomancer of the Order of the Ebon Hand who created the thrulls for use in the Order's sacrificial rites. All was well and good until he bred some with intelligence and ability to use magic, a la [Thrull Wizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrull Wizard). He was supposedly executed by the Order for this crime, and the Order was subsequently overrun and destroyed by the rampaging monsters (as represented in his second ability.) See http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Search/Default.aspx?action=advanced&flavor=+ for a list of cards referencing the man.
posts.html:
Each Time Spiral card was an homage to at least one previously printed card. The legendary creatures in these sets were also all characters from previous sets who had yet to see print.

This card depicts the biomancer of the Order of the Ebon Hand who created the thrulls for use in the Order's sacrificial rites. All was well and good until he bred some with intelligence and ability to use magic, a la Thrull Wizard. He was supposedly executed by the Order for this crime, and the Order was subsequently overrun and destroyed by the rampaging monsters (as represented in his second ability.) See http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Search/Default.aspx?action=advanced&flavor=+ for a list of cards referencing the man.

posts.post_content:
[Conspiracy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conspiracy) may not explicitly state that the type is in addition to its current type(s), but the first ruling on the card states:  
  
"It does not replace any use of creature types in card text."
posts.html:
Conspiracy may not explicitly state that the type is in addition to its current type(s), but the first ruling on the card states:

"It does not replace any use of creature types in card text."

posts.post_content:
I like how they're going back to the storyline flavour with this card. Look at the flavour texts of [Thrull Wizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrull Wizard) and [Breeding Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breeding Pit) if you don't understand.
  
   
Funnily enough, through, the flavour text of [Derelor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Derelor) implies he died for entirely different reasons. TIME STREAMS, SON.

posts.post_content:
Thank you Alsebra. I was just about to Copy and paste the rule before I read your post but lets take it a step farther. Some cards have additional rules to explain stuff when wotc fails to make things clear or when they make changes to the game rules that would effect how a card would be played. You can find them at the bottum of the page under the details tab.  
  
[Dross Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dross Golem) with 3 swamps he cost ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) but his CMC is still ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol) so you get 5 thrulls.

posts.post_content:
AlphaNumerical, he *is* a master breeder, he just isn't very good at controlling his minions, those are two different things.  
  
If you've got a deck that runs on creatures going to your graveyard, [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) puts all of your thrulls right into your graveyard, triggering Blood Artist and whatnot a million times.  
Also works like a charm with [Attrition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Attrition)
posts.html:
AlphaNumerical, he is a master breeder, he just isn't very good at controlling his minions, those are two different things.

If you've got a deck that runs on creatures going to your graveyard, Heartless Summoning puts all of your thrulls right into your graveyard, triggering Blood Artist and whatnot a million times.
Also works like a charm with Attrition
